org.openimaj.image.objectdetection

Interface MultiScaleObjectDetector<IMAGE extends Image<?,IMAGE>,DETECTED_OBJECT>

  • Type Parameters:
    IMAGE - The image on which to perform the detection
    DETECTED_OBJECT - the type of object representing a detection.
    All Superinterfaces:
    ObjectDetector<IMAGE,DETECTED_OBJECT>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractMultiScaleObjectDetector, Detector, HOGDetector, MultiThreadedDetector

    public interface MultiScaleObjectDetector<IMAGE extends Image<?,IMAGE>,DETECTED_OBJECT>
extends ObjectDetector<IMAGE,DETECTED_OBJECT>
    Interface describing a multi-scale object detector. Optional methods are provided for controlling the detection size.

    Any type of Java object can be used to represent a detection; this could be something as simple as a Rectangle representing the spatial location of the detection, or it could be much more complex.

    The interface allows for multiple detections to be returned from the input image. If required, these detections could be filtered by a DetectionFilter as a post-processing operation.

    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
    See Also:
    ObjectDetector

      • setMaximumDetectionSize

        void setMaximumDetectionSize(int size)
        (Optional operation).

        Set the maximum detection size. A size less than or equal to 0 indicates there is no maximum size.

        Parameters:
        size - the maximum detection size.
